title: Hick's Law
description: More options leads to harder decisions.

title: Confirmation Bias
description: People look for evidence that confirms what they think.

title: Priming
description: Previous stimuli influence users' decisions.

title: Cognitive Load
description: The total amount of mental effort required to complete a task.

title: Anchoring Bias
description: Users rely heavily on the first piece of information they see.

title: Nudge
description: Subtle hints can affect users' decisions.

title: Progressive Disclosure
description: Users are less overwhelmed if complex features are revealed later.

title: Fitts's Law
description: Large and close elements are easier to interact with.

title: Banner Blindness
description: Users tune out repeatedly exposed content.

title: Decoy Effect
description: Introduce a discardable option to influence choice.

title: Framing
description: The way information is presented affects how decisions are made.

title: Attentional Bias
description: Peopleâ€™s thoughts filter what they pay attention to.

title: Empathy Gap
description: People underestimate how emotions influence behavior.

title: Visual Anchors
description: Elements used to guide users' eyes.

title: Von Restorff Effect
description: People notice items that stand out more.

title: Visual Hierarchy
description: The order in which people perceive visual elements.

title: Selective Attention
description: Users filter out irrelevant elements when focused.

title: Survivorship Bias
description: People neglect things that fail to pass a selection process.

title: Juxtaposition
description: Close and similar elements are perceived as related.

title: Signifiers
description: Elements that communicate their function or behavior.

title: Contrast
description: Users' attention is drawn to elements with higher visual weight.
